Hello @BobCat...........

I posted a question earlier, but I will ask again.

Is there anyway to update or modify the .cfg for the buran's cargo doors so that they can be opened in the VAB?

I thank you for any help or ideas.

Hello @BobCat...........

I posted a question earlier, but I will ask again.

Is there anyway to update or modify the .cfg for the buran's cargo doors so that they can be opened in the VAB?

I thank you for any help or ideas.

In my opinion, you can simply put in the CFG- animSwitch = True?False

drtedastro

for what ?

drtedastro

for what ?

Put in cargo and such...?
Exactly.... to outfit the cargo bay. Other than pulling top off and such.

Pulling the top off works, and solar panel animation can't really be made tweakable. Also note, the way it's done now, you can start with closed doors on the pad. It's better than having it open at launch.

Put in cargo and such...?

Remove cargo door

Put cargo in cargo bay

Put door back

i think this no hard

now im try fix more hard KSP problems and no have time to "i wish" tweaks.

Edited February 23, 2014 by BobCat

What problems? I've been working on the Space Shuttle lately, and managed to overcome many difficult problems. I even managed to balance realistically placed RCS on the Shuttle (and I could do that on Buran, too, if you wanted ). Also, I've figured out a great deal of engine gimbal stuff. What exactly are you having problems with?
Updated Buran need new (good working) robotic arm

Infernal Robotics. here's the plugin: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/37707-0-23-Techtree-Magic-Smoke-Industries-Parts-Infernal-Robotics-0-12-(1-30-2014)

You could split your robotic arm into parts and let IR handle the movement. AFAIK, it's more stable than Romfarer's arms, and the plugin has less overhead. The only downside is that it doesn't include any grab mechanism, so you have two options:

1. You could use KAS for that, with which you're familiar already, I believe. This will pretty much duplicate what Romfarer's arms can do, but in a more reliable way.

2. You could make a custom, surface-attachable docking port that would dock with the mount part. This would be more realistic, the real CanadArm uses grapple fixtures to grab large objects, and I suspect it'd work like that on Buran, too.

Also, Infernal Robotics has support for rails, so you could replicate the CanadArm 2's MBS using them, too.
I present you, the KTSP!!!
